title: 35,000MT of 92 Octane to Sri Lanka under Indian Credit Line
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st): A ship carrying 35,000 metric tonnes of 92 Octane Petrol under the Indian Line of Credit will reach Sri Lanka on Thursday (Mar. 24), the Ministry of Energy said.
Despite assurances from the authorities, people continue to wait in queues at filling stations across the country, to purchase Diesel and Kerosene Oil as the fuel crisis remains unresolved.
More northern Sri Lankans flee to India over high cost of living
South Korea nearly doubles manufacturing quota for Sri Lankan migrant workers
